results.title: AMPK activation improves recovery from pneumonia-induced lung injury via reduction of er-stress and apoptosis in alveolar epithelial cells
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_287 @@@P. aeruginosa@@@-induced @DISEASE_Lung_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D055370 @@@lung injury@@@ resulted in accumulation of neutrophils and cellular debris in the alveolar space along with persistent (96 h) ER-stress and apoptosis of AECs. While @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@lung infection@@@ triggered @GENE_PRKAA1 @GENE_5562 @@@AMPK@@@ inactivation (de-phosphorylation of Thr172-@GENE_PRKAA1 @GENE_5562 @@@AMPK@@@), @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_tideglusib @CHEMICAL_MESH:C520571 @@@Tideglusib@@@ promptly restored the @GENE_PRKAA1 @GENE_5562 @@@AMPK@@@ activation status.

citations.NLM: Becker E Jr, Husain M, Bone N, Smith S, Morris P, Zmijewski JW. AMPK activation improves recovery from pneumonia-induced lung injury via reduction of er-stress and apoptosis in alveolar epithelial cells Respir Res. 2023 Jul 12;24(1):185. PMID: 37438806
citations.BibTeX: @article{37438806, title={AMPK activation improves recovery from pneumonia-induced lung injury via reduction of er-stress and apoptosis in alveolar epithelial cells}, author={Becker E Jr and Husain M and Bone N and Smith S and Morris P and Zmijewski JW}, journal={Respir Res}, volume={24}, number={1}, pages={185}}

results.title: Long-term metformin use and risk of pneumonia and related death in type 2 diabetes: a registry-based cohort study.
results.text_hl: AIMS/HYPOTHESIS: The long-term effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in individuals with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@ who are at increased risk of severe @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@respiratory infections@@@ are unknown.

citations.NLM: Yang A, Shi M, Wu H, Lau ESH, Ma RCW, Kong APS, So WY, Luk AOY, Chan JCN, Chow E. Long-term metformin use and risk of pneumonia and related death in type 2 diabetes: a registry-based cohort study. Diabetologia. 2021 Aug;64(8):1760-1765. PMID: 33844069

results.title: Metformin Use Is Associated With Lower Mortality in Veterans With Diabetes Hospitalized With Pneumonia.
results.text_hl: Additional research is needed to examine the safety and potential benefits of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@respiratory infections@@@.

citations.NLM: Mohammed T, Bowe M, Plant A, Perez M, Alvarez CA, Mortensen EM. Metformin Use Is Associated With Lower Mortality in Veterans With Diabetes Hospitalized With Pneumonia. Clin Infect Dis. 2022 Dec 28;():. PMID: 36575139

results.title: Interventions for preventing the progression of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease.
results.text_hl: There may be no difference in serious adverse events; however, treatment probably increases @DISEASE_Nocturia @DISEASE_MESH:D053158 @@@nocturia@@@, @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ and liver enzymes, may increase @DISEASE_Xerostomia @DISEASE_MESH:D014987 @@@dry mouth@@@ and thirst, and may decrease @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@urinary and upper respiratory tract infections@@@.

citations.NLM: St Pierre K, Cashmore BA, Bolignano D, Zoccali C, Ruospo M, Craig JC, Strippoli GF, Mallett AJ, Green SC, Tunnicliffe DJ. Interventions for preventing the progression of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease. Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2024 Oct 2;10(10):CD010294. PMID: 39356039

results.title: Diabetes mellitus without metformin intake is associated with worse oncologic outcomes after radical nephroureterectomy for upper tract urothelial carcinoma.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes mellitus@@@ without @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ intake is associated with worse @DISEASE_Cancer_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D000072716 @@@oncologic@@@ outcomes after radical nephroureterectomy for @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@upper tract urothelial carcinoma@@@.

results.title: Metformin reduces airway glucose permeability and hyperglycaemia-induced Staphylococcus aureus load independently of effects on blood glucose
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ might, therefore, be of additional benefit in the prevention and treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@respiratory infection@@@.

citations.NLM: Garnett JP, Baker EH, Naik S, Lindsay JA, Knight GM, Gill S, Tregoning JS, Baines DL. Metformin reduces airway glucose permeability and hyperglycaemia-induced Staphylococcus aureus load independently of effects on blood glucose Thorax. 2013 Sep;68(9):835-45. PMID: 23709760

results.title: Metformin prevents the effects of Pseudomonas aeruginosa on airway epithelial tight junctions and restricts hyperglycaemia-induced bacterial growth
results.text_hl: Further investigation into the mechanisms regulating @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @SPECIES_287 @@@P. aeruginosa@@@ action on airway epithelial tight junctions could yield new therapeutic targets to prevent/suppress hyperglycaemia-induced @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@respiratory infections@@@, avoiding the use of antibiotics.

citations.NLM: Patkee WR, Carr G, Baker EH, Baines DL, Garnett JP. Metformin prevents the effects of Pseudomonas aeruginosa on airway epithelial tight junctions and restricts hyperglycaemia-induced bacterial growth J Cell Mol Med. 2016 Apr;20(4):758-64. PMID: 26837005

results.title: Type 2 diabetes mellitus in elderly institutionalized patients.
results.text_hl: A 93-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ is admitted to a conventional hospital ward for an @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@acute respiratory infection@@@.
